children.name: Medicine and Dentistry
Pre-clinical medicine
children.definition: Vocational science of preventing, diagnosing, alleviating or curing disease in homo sapiens. Includes such areas as Anatomy, Physiology, Pharmacy and Nutrition which can be specialisms in their own right.

children.name: Pre-clinical dentistry
children.definition: Vocational science concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of damage, disease and disorder to the teeth and gums of homo sapiens.

children.name: Clinical medicine
children.definition: The observation, diagnosis and treatment of an illness or disease through direct interaction with human patients.

children.name: Clinical dentistry
children.definition: The observation, diagnosis and treatment of disease or damage to teeth and gums through direct interaction with human patients.

children.name: Others in medicine & dentistry
Medicine & dentistry not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Medicine and Dentistry categories. To be used sparingly.
Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Medicine and Dentistry categories. To be used sparingly.
N/A

children.name: Subjects Allied to Medicine
Anatomy, physiology & pathology
Anatomy
children.definition: The scientific study of the structure and function of the human body, including tissues, organs and systems.

children.name: Physiology
Clinical physiology
children.definition: The study of the major physiology systems in humans, measurement techniques in their normal and abnormal function, and their use in the diagnosis and treatment of disease.
The study of the function and behaviour of the human body, including subjects such as respiration, circulation, digestion, excretion, reproduction and neuroscience.

children.name: Pathology
Cellular pathology
children.definition: The study of the effects and nature of diseases in cellular structures.

children.name: Pathobiology
children.definition: The study of the biological nature of diseases.
The study of the nature, causes and development of human diseases, and the mechanisms of disease infestation and transfer.

children.name: Neuroscience
children.definition: The study of the anatomy, physiology, biophysics, biochemistry, molecular biology, pharmacology and behaviour of human nerve cells and nervous systems.

children.name: Physiotherapy
children.definition: The study of the planning and execution of treatment programmes to prevent or remedy physical dysfunction, relieve pain and prevent further disability.

children.name: Podiatry
children.definition: The study of the diagnosis and management of pathologies of the lower limb and foot.

children.name: Anatomy, physiology & pathology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Anatomy, Physiology and Pathology categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the human body and how it is affected by disease. Includes study at cellular and molecular levels.

children.name: Pharmacology, toxicology & pharmacy
Pharmacology
children.definition: The study of the therapeutic and toxic effects of drugs on human tissues and systems.

children.name: Toxicology
children.definition: The study of the nature, source, identification and characteristics of poisons, toxic substances, and exogenous chemical agents and their effects on human tissues and systems.

children.name: Pharmacy
children.definition: The study of the professional practice of pharmacy. Includes instruction in principles of medicinal chemistry, drug behaviour, and mixing, preparing and dispensing of prescription medications.

children.name: Pharmacology, toxicology & pharmacy not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Pharmacology, Toxicology and Pharmacy categories. To be used sparingly.

The study of drugs, their characteristics, actions and uses. Includes the study of poisons, their nature, effects and antidotes. Also includes how drugs and other chemicals interact with biological systems.

children.name: Complementary medicines, therapies & well-being
Osteopathy
children.definition: The treatment of disease through the manipulation of bones.

children.name: Chiropractic
children.definition: The diagnosis and manipulative treatment of mechanical disorders of the joints.

children.name: Alternative medicine & therapies
Chinese
children.definition: The study of the range of medical techniques with roots in China, such as moxibustion, massage, cupping, gwa sha, breath work (Qi Gong) and exercise (Tai Chi).

children.name: Herbalism
children.definition: The use of herbs in the treatment of illness.

children.name: Acupuncture
children.definition: The method of treating various conditions by pricking the skin or tissues with needles.

children.name: Aromatherapy
children.definition: The use of plant extracts and essential oils in massage.

children.name: Hypnotherapy
children.definition: The treatment of disease by hypnosis.

children.name: Reflexology
children.definition: A system of massage through reflex points on the feet, hands and head used to relieve tension and treat illness.
The study of the methods of diagnosis and treatment considered outside the scope of mainstream medicine in the UK.

children.name: Hair & beauty science
Hair services
children.definition: The study of hairdressing services, skills and knowledge required to meet clients' needs including hair and scalp disease and disorders.

children.name: Beauty therapies
children.definition: The study of therapies to enhance well-being, appearance, relaxation or uplift to meet clients' needs. Includes treatments such as injectibles and laser/light therapies.

children.name: Make-up
children.definition: The study of treatments carried out to enhance the appearance of individuals. This can include the application of camouflage make-up.
The study of services and treatments carried out in the hair, beauty and nail sectors and the sciences related to them.

children.name: Spa & water-based therapies
children.definition: The study of water-based therapies, treatments and services to enhance the face, body, health and well-being.

children.name: Complementary medicines, therapies & well-being not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects not elsewhere classified. To be used sparingly.
The study of medicines and therapies not covered within clinical medicines to prevent and alleviate illness and disease as well as enhance health and well-being.

children.name: Nutrition
Dietetics
children.definition: The study of nutritional services, menu planning and diet formulation for individuals, families and institutions.

children.name: Nutrition not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Dietetics categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the process of assimilating nutrient materials into animal or plant tissue. Designed to enhance health and the quality of life of those treated.

children.name: Ophthalmics
Optometry
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques for examining, diagnosing and treating conditions of the human visual system.

children.name: Orthoptics
children.definition: The study of principles and techniques for the correction of vision defects in humans using therapeutic exercises.

children.name: Ophthalmics not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Ophthalmic categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the eye, disruption to sight and diseases of the eye. Also includes treatment of eye disorders.

children.name: Aural & oral sciences
Audiology
children.definition: The study of the anatomy and physiology of the human hearing organs, their function and malfunction, and related environmental and behavioural topics.

children.name: Speech science
children.definition: The study of the anatomy and physiology of the human speech organs, their function and malfunction, and related environmental and behavioural topics.

children.name: Language pathology
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques of therapies for persons with physical or behavioural disorders that affect speaking or comprehension.

children.name: Aural & oral sciences not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Aural and Oral Science categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of speech and hearing and problems that can occur with them. Includes the treatment of hearing defects and speech impediments.

children.name: Nursing
Palliative care nursing
children.definition: The study of principles and techniques for assessing, managing, treating and monitoring the provision of palliative care for individuals with life-limiting conditions.

children.name: Clinical practice nursing
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques for assessing, managing, treating and monitoring in the following care specialisms: diabetes, cancer, cardiac, renal, respiratory disease or disorders or sexual health.

children.name: Community nursing
Health visiting
children.definition: The study of the promotion of health and health education specialising in working with families with children under 5 years old and older people.

children.name: School nursing
children.definition: The study of principles and techniques for the provision of nursing care within a school setting or to children and young people of school age.

children.name: Practice nursing
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques for the assessing, screening, treating, care and education of patients within general practitioner practices.
The study of principles and techniques for assessing, managing, treating and monitoring the health care needs of patients and families outside of a hospital environment.

children.name: Midwifery
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques to allow midwives to deliver babies and treat mothers in the pre-natal, delivery and post-delivery periods.

children.name: Children's nursing
Neonatal care
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to support and provide care for new-born babies who are premature or who are born sick, and their families.
The study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to support and provide care for children and their families, from infancy to adolescence.

children.name: Adult nursing
Older people nursing
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to assess, manage, treat and monitor the provision of care for older adults.
The study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to assess, manage, treat and monitor the provision of care of adults in a variety of settings.

children.name: Dental nursing
children.definition: The study of principles and techniques in providing assistance to dentists undertaking procedures and care to persons undergoing such procedures.

children.name: Mental health nursing
Learning disability nursing
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques to provide support for children and adults with learning difficulties.
The study of the principles and therapeutic interventions that allow nurses to provide care for people with mental health needs.

children.name: Medical nursing
Critical care nursing
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to assess, manage, treat and monitor the provision of care to critically ill patients.

children.name: Surgical nursing
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to assess, manage, treat and monitor the provision of care for patients undergoing surgical intervention.

children.name: Emergency nursing
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to assess, manage, treat and monitor the provision of care for patients at first contact in the Emergency department.
The study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to assess, manage, treat and monitor the provision of care for patients undergoing investigations that do not require surgical intervention.

children.name: Nursing not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Nursing categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of principles and techniques for assessing, managing, treating and monitoring patients.

children.name: Medical technology
Cardiography
children.definition: The study of techniques aimed at diagnosing disorders of the human cardiovascular system.

children.name: Radiology
Radiography, diagnostic
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques in the use of radiation to provide medical diagnostic information.

children.name: Radiography, therapeutic
children.definition: The study of the treatment of human diseases by means of controlled exposure to forms of radiation.
The study of the principles and techniques in the use of radiation to provide diagnostic information and therapy in medicine.

children.name: Biomechanics & prosthetics (non-clinical)
children.definition: The study of the mechanical laws relating to the movement and structure of the human body.

children.name: Dental technology
children.definition: The study of the design and fabrication of dental prosthetics and restorative appliances.

children.name: Mortuary technology
children.definition: The study of the techniques/processes and equipment relating to the storage of deceased human beings.

children.name: Medical technology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Medical Technology categories. To be used sparingly.

The study of the use and development of medical equipment and its potential, including that used in radiography. Also involves understanding the effects of the various forms of radiation used to display and treat damage or illness.

children.name: Others in subjects allied to medicine
Environmental health
children.definition: The study of the monitoring and evaluation of health hazards and the planning and management of public health programmes.

children.name: Occupational health
children.definition: The monitoring and evaluation of health standards related to industrial and commercial workplaces and locations.

children.name: Occupational therapy
children.definition: The study of therapeutic regimes to assist recovery from mental or physical ailments/injury.

children.name: Counselling
children.definition: The study of the provision of support services aimed at helping people to maintain a healthy and positive mental disposition in addressing problems.

children.name: Paramedical science
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques to allow provision of on-site care for persons with acute illnesses or injuries.

children.name: Physician assistant studies
children.definition: The study of the principles and techniques required to take medical histories, perform examinations, diagnose illnesses, and analyse test results under direct supervision of a doctor.

children.name: Subjects allied to medicine not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the Others in Subjects Allied to Medicine categories. To be used sparingly.
Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Subjects Allied to Medicine categories. To be used sparingly.
N/A

children.name: Biological Sciences
Biology
Applied biology
Parasitology
children.definition: The study of the transmission and control of parasitic diseases and their vectors.
Topics in Biology of commercial or social importance.

children.name: Behavioural biology
children.definition: The study of the behavioural strategies used by organisms in their natural environment to maximise fitness. Includes foraging, social and reproductive (including parental care, sexual selection and mate choice) behaviour, behavioural responses to predators, communication, migration and homing.

children.name: Cell biology
Applied cell biology
children.definition: Topics in Cell Biology of commercial or social importance.
Concerned with the organisation of the cell, cell membrane and cell communication.

children.name: Developmental/Reproductive biology
Developmental biology
children.definition: The study of the development of multi-cellular organisms.

children.name: Reproductive biology
children.definition: The study of the reproduction of multi-cellular organisms.
The study of the development and reproduction of multi-cellular organisms and the differentiation of cells, tissues and organs.

children.name: Environmental biology
children.definition: Relates animals and plants to their terrestrial and marine habitats.

children.name: Marine/Freshwater biology
Marine biology
children.definition: The study of saltwater and oceanic biology.

children.name: Freshwater biology
children.definition: The study of freshwater and estuarine biology.
The study of aquatic biology.

children.name: Population biology
children.definition: The study of organism numbers and population dynamics.

children.name: Ecology
Biodiversity
children.definition: Concentrates on the design and development of different species and their interrelationships.

children.name: Evolution
children.definition: The study of organisms' adaptation to their environment and the mechanisms of heredity and change.

children.name: Community ecology
children.definition: The study of the structure, composition and dynamics of ecological assemblages. Includes the relationship between species assemblages and their environments, trophic structure, succession, stability, biodiversity, coexistence and competitive exclusion, spatial structure and relative abundance of component species.

children.name: Conservation ecology
children.definition: The study of the science underpinning the restoration and conservation of species and communities and their natural habitat.

children.name: Ecosystem ecology & land use
children.definition: The study of large-scale ecology including catchment and regional studies, landscape ecology and interactions between ecology and land use patterns.

children.name: Population ecology
children.definition: The study of the understanding of population dynamics, including trophic interactions, demography of populations, extinction processes, spatial processes and metapopulation dynamics.

children.name: Ecotoxicology
children.definition: The study of the branch of toxicology concerned with toxic effects caused by natural or synthetic pollutants, to the constituents of ecosystems, (animal (including human), vegetable and microbial) in an integral context. Includes diagnostics, tolerance and adaptation in relation to natural and anthropogenic toxic substances.
The study of organisms in their environment, their interactions and history.

children.name: Biology not elsewhere classified
Biometry
children.definition: Concerned with the quantitative techniques and measurement in the biological Sciences.
Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Biology categories. To be used sparingly.
A broadly based scientific study of living organisms, both animal and vegetable. Includes their structure, functions, evolution, distribution and interrelationships.

children.name: Botany
Applied botany
children.definition: Topics in Botany of commercial or social importance.

children.name: Mycology
children.definition: The study of fungi, symbiotic relationships and their role in decay.

children.name: Plant biotechnology
children.definition: Involves the molecular and microbial manipulation of plants.

children.name: Plant cell science
children.definition: Concerned with the cellular organisation and function in plants.

children.name: Plant pathology
children.definition: Concerned with the diseases of plants and their treatments.

children.name: Plant physiology
children.definition: The study of the area of botany concerned with the function or physiology of plants. This includes processes such as photosynthesis, respiration, plant nutrition, plant hormone functions, tropisms, nastic movements, photoperiodism, photomorphogenesis, circadian rhythms, environmental stress physiology, seed germination, dormancy and stomata function and transpiration.

children.name: Developmental & reproductive plant biology
children.definition: The study of plant growth related to reproduction and development.

children.name: Systematic botany
children.definition: The study of morphological, numerical and molecular methods of identifying and classifying living and fossil plants. Includes the reconstruction of phylogenies.

children.name: Botany not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Botany categories. To be used sparingly.

The study of plants including their classification, structure, physiology, ecology and economic importance. Includes the importance of plants for a balanced ecosystem including the process of energy fixation and conversion in to the biosphere (and thus with food and fuel). May also be called Plant Science.

children.name: Zoology
Applied zoology
children.definition: Zoological topics of commercial or social importance, e.g. animal disease and eradication.

children.name: Cell zoology
children.definition: Concerned with the cellular organisation and function in animals.

children.name: Developmental & reproductive zoology
children.definition: The study of the reproduction and development of animals, including embryos, fertilisation, foetal growth and maturation, ovarian function, fertility and the differentiation of cells, tissues and organs.

children.name: Entomology
children.definition: The study of insects, including their role as pests.

children.name: Marine zoology
children.definition: The biological study of animals in seawater environments.

children.name: Pest science
children.definition: Concerned with vertebrate and invertebrate pests, their roles as disease vectors and agents of damage, and their control.

children.name: Systematic zoology
children.definition: The study of morphological, numerical and molecular methods of identifying and classifying living and fossil animals, including reconstruction of phylogenies.

children.name: Zoology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Zoology categories. To be used sparingly.
The scientific study of all aspects of animal biology: their reproduction, development, physiology, behaviour, mechanics of locomotion, diseases and interactions with the environment.

children.name: Genetics
Applied genetics
children.definition: Topics in genetics of commercial or social importance, e.g. in animal and plant breeding, but not exclusively involving Genetic Engineering, which is coded as C460.

children.name: Human genetics
children.definition: The study of the genetics of the human species, including chromosome theory and the mechanism of gene action.

children.name: Medical & veterinary genetics
Medical genetics
children.definition: The investigation of genetic abnormalities and their treatment in humans.

children.name: Veterinary genetics
children.definition: The investigation of genetic abnormalities and their treatment in animals.
The investigation of genetic anomalies' and their treatment.

children.name: Molecular genetics
Transcriptomics
children.definition: The study of transcriptomics; the branch of chemistry which deals with the study of messenger RNA molecules produced in one or a population of cell types.
The study of genetic factors and processes at molecular level.

children.name: Genomics
Functional genomics
children.definition: The study of functional genomics; the branch of molecular biology that uses data produced by genomic projects (such as genome sequencing projects) to describe gene (and protein) functions and interactions. Functional genomics focuses on the dynamic aspects such as gene transcription, translation, and protein-protein interactions.

children.name: Genome organisation
children.definition: The study of adult stem cells, chromosome duplication, chromosome structure, comparative mapping, gene mapping, genome rearrangements, ploidy, Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP), genome evolution and telomeres.
The branch of genetics that studies organisms in terms of their genomes (their full DNA sequences).

children.name: Genetic engineering
children.definition: The use of various methods to manipulate the DNA (genetic material) of cells to change hereditary traits or produce biological products.

children.name: Population genetics & evolution
children.definition: The study of speciation and population genetics, gene flow/population structure, hybrid zones, island populations, genetic drift and conservation genetics. This includes adaptation and the evolution of life histories.

children.name: Genetics not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do fit into other Genetics categories. To be used sparingly.
The scientific study of origin, heredity and variation in organisms; includes the inheritance of biological information.

children.name: Microbiology
Applied microbiology
children.definition: The study of topics in microbiology of commercial, environmental or social importance. Includes interactions between the environment and microbial systems, bioremediation and microbial diversity.

children.name: Medical & veterinary microbiology
Medical microbiology
children.definition: The study of the interactions between micro-organism and their human hosts.

children.name: Veterinary microbiology
children.definition: The study of the interactions between micro-organisms and their animal hosts.
The study of the interactions between micro-organisms and their hosts.

children.name: Bacteriology
children.definition: The study of bacteria and bacterial diseases.

children.name: Virology
children.definition: The study of viruses and viral diseases.

children.name: Immunology
children.definition: The study of the immune system as a defence mechanism against infection.

children.name: Serology
children.definition: The study of sera and blood-related products.

children.name: Microbiology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Microbiology categories.  To be used sparingly.
The scientific study of micro-organisms encompassing major components of genetics and molecular biology. Includes bacteriology, virology, cell structure and function, and may include some immunology.

children.name: Sport & exercise science
Sport coaching
children.definition: The study of the delivery (teaching, instructing and coaching) of enhanced sport performance and the critical analysis of the integration of the variables involved.

children.name: Sport development
children.definition: The monitoring, analysis, diagnosis and prescription of actions to enhance the component elements of sport.

children.name: Sport conditioning, rehabilitation & therapy
children.definition: The applied scientific study of anatomy, biomechanics, physiology and psychology within the context of human body conditioning, sport-related injuries and rehabilitation.

children.name: Sport studies
children.definition: The study of the nature and provision of sport through analysis of its socio-cultural and health impacts.

children.name: Sport technology
children.definition: The study of the impact of technology and ergonomics to advance sport performance through the study of biomechanics, physiology, psychology and materials technology.

children.name: Sport & exercise science not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other sport and exercise categories. To be used sparingly.

The applied scientific study of the anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and psychology of the human body with a view to optimising performance in sporting and physical activities. Includes non-teacher training physical education.

children.name: Molecular biology, biophysics & biochemistry
Applied molecular biology, biophysics & biochemistry
children.definition: Topics in molecular biology, biophysics and biochemistry of commercial or social importance.

children.name: Biological chemistry
children.definition: The study of the molecules and compounds that make up cells and organisms; how they are formed and how they interact. Includes the study of Molecular Biology.

children.name: Metabolic biochemistry
children.definition: Covers the biochemical aspects of metabolic processes.

children.name: Medical & veterinary biochemistry
Medical biochemistry
children.definition: Covers the biochemical aspects of metabolic processes in humans.

children.name: Veterinary biochemistry
children.definition: Covers the biochemical aspects of metabolic processes in animals.
The study of the molecular basis of health and illness.

children.name: Plant biochemistry
children.definition: Concerned with cellular processes in plants including the understanding of the expression of genetic information.

children.name: Biomolecular science
children.definition: The study of the molecular processes in the life sciences.

children.name: Biophysical science
children.definition: The use of the methods of physical science in the biological sciences.

children.name: Molecular biology, biophysics & biochemistry not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Molecular Biology, Biophysics and Biochemistry categories. To be used sparingly.

The scientific study of the chemical compounds and reactions occurring in the cells of living organisms including the molecular and biochemical analysis of life processes. Involves aspects of cellular organisation processes. and specialisation and how the structure and function of DNA, RNA proteins, enzymes and membranes determine biological.

children.name: Psychology
Applied psychology
Occupational psychology
children.definition: The psychology of selection, motivation and performance in the workplace.

children.name: Educational psychology
children.definition: The psychology of learning and teaching in educational settings.

children.name: Sport psychology
children.definition: The psychology of sport.

children.name: Organisational psychology
children.definition: The psychology of human behaviour in organisational settings.

children.name: Business psychology
children.definition: The applications of psychology to business contexts.

children.name: Forensic psychology
children.definition: The psychological aspects of crime and criminal behaviour.
The application of psychological evidence and theories to real world situations.

children.name: Developmental psychology
Child psychology
children.definition: The study of the development of psychological processes in childhood.

children.name: The psychology of ageing
children.definition: Psychological aspects of the ageing process in adults.
The study of the development of psychological processes across the life cycle.

children.name: Methodological & conceptual issues in psychology
Research methods in psychology
children.definition: The study of the techniques, methodology and statistical procedures used in psychology.

children.name: Quantitative psychology
children.definition: The use of measurement, quantitative and statistical techniques in psychological testing.

children.name: Qualitative psychology
children.definition: The use and analysis of qualitative techniques in psychology.

children.name: History of psychology
children.definition: The historical development of methodology and theory in psychology.

children.name: Philosophy of psychology
children.definition: Philosophical and conceptual issues underlying psychology.
Investigation into fundamental psychological processes.

children.name: Psychology in health & medicine
Health psychology
children.definition: The study of the psychological factors in maintaining and recovering physical well-being.

children.name: Clinical psychology
children.definition: The study and treatment of psychological disorder.

children.name: Counselling psychology
children.definition: The study and application of psychological processes of counselling.

children.name: Psychotherapy
children.definition: The study and application of psychological processes of therapy.

children.name: Clinical neuropsychology
children.definition: The study of clinical aspects of the psychological consequences of neurological disorders.

children.name: Community psychology
children.definition: The applications of psychology in community contexts.

children.name: Psychoanalytical studies
children.definition: The application of psychodynamic approaches within psychology.

children.name: Psychology of mental health
children.definition: The study of psychological well-being.
The application of psychology to physiological and physical well-being.

children.name: Cognitive & affective psychology
Psychological modelling
children.definition: The application of psychology to the development and application of computational models of cognitive processes.

children.name: Psychology of communication
children.definition: The study of psychological processes in verbal and non-verbal communication.

children.name: Psychology of memory & learning
children.definition: The study of psychological processes of memory and learning.

children.name: Psychology of perception
children.definition: The study of psychological processes in perception.

children.name: Psychology of higher cognitive processes
children.definition: The study of thinking, reasoning, decision-making and problem solving.

children.name: Experimental psychology
children.definition: The experimental investigation of behavioural and mental processes.

children.name: Affective psychology
children.definition: Psychology of emotional behaviour.

children.name: Transpersonal psychology
children.definition: The study of psychological aspects of spiritual and mystic experience.
The study of the mechanism and processes associated with perception, learning, language, memory and the emotions.

children.name: Psychobiology
Cognitive neuroscience
children.definition: The study of neural mechanisms underlying cognitive processes.

children.name: Affective neuroscience
children.definition: The study of neural mechanisms underlying emotional behaviour.

children.name: Psychopharmacology
children.definition: The study of the behavioural and psychological effects of drugs.

children.name: Evolutionary psychology
children.definition: The study of evolutionary explanations of psychology.

children.name: Animal psychology
children.definition: The study of cognitive processes in animals.
Biological explanations of psychological processes.

children.name: Personality & individual differences
Psychometrics
children.definition: The psychological testing of personality and individual differences.

children.name: Psychology of gender
children.definition: The study of the influence of gender on psychological processes.

children.name: Cross-cultural psychology
children.definition: The study of the influence of culture on psychological processes.
The study of psychological factors in individual differences.

children.name: Social psychology
Social cognition
children.definition: The study of the cognitive processes involved in social interactions.
The study of behaviour and mental processes in social contexts.

children.name: Psychology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Psychology categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of behavioural and mental processes. May include study of the brain, the senses, and the biological and physiological bases of behaviour.

children.name: Others in Biological Sciences
Applied biological sciences
children.definition: Topics in Other Biological Sciences of commercial or social importance.

children.name: Biological sciences not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the Others in Biological (or Life) Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.
Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Biological (or Life) Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.
N/A

children.name: Veterinary Sciences, Agriculture and related subjects
Pre-clinical veterinary medicine
Pre-clinical veterinary medicine not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Pre-clinical Veterinary Medicine categories. To be used sparingly.
Vocational science concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of disease in animals.

children.name: Clinical veterinary medicine & dentistry
Clinical veterinary medicine
children.definition: The observation, diagnosis and treatment of illness, disease or damage through direct interaction with non-human patients.

children.name: Clinical veterinary dentistry
children.definition: The observation, diagnosis and treatment of illness, disease or damage to the teeth and gums through direct interaction with non-human patients.

children.name: Clinical veterinary medicine & dentistry not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Clinical Veterinary Medicine and Dentistry categories. To be used sparingly.
The observation, diagnosis and treatment of illness, disease or damage through direct interaction with non-human patients.

children.name: Animal science
Veterinary nursing
children.definition: Vocational science concerning the practical care of sick, injured and/or infirm animals.

children.name: Animal health
Animal anatomy
children.definition: The study of the physical structure of an animal, how each part works and is related. Studies include dissection and use of microscope slides.

children.name: Animal physiology
children.definition: The study of systemic function and behaviour of the animal frame, including processes such as respiration, circulation, digestion, excretion, and reproduction.

children.name: Animal pathology
children.definition: The study of the effect of disease and/or damage to the animal frame. Studies include dissection and use of microscope slides.

children.name: Animal pharmacology
children.definition: The study of drugs, their characteristics, actions, uses and effects on different animals.

children.name: Animal toxicology
children.definition: The study of poisons, their nature, effect on different animals and possible antidotes.

children.name: Animal pharmacy
children.definition: The study of the preparation and dispensing of animal-related drugs. Involves an understanding of the food-chain and its interaction with human beings.

children.name: Animal nutrition
children.definition: The study of the process of assimilating nutrient materials into animal tissue.

children.name: Animal welfare
children.definition: The study of the health, contentment and well being of animals, how such contentment should be maintained and the laws concerning animal housing and provision.
The study of animal diseases with the object of prevention or diagnosis and cure.

children.name: Veterinary public health
children.definition: The study of the prevention of the spread of disease from animals to man.

children.name: Overseas veterinary development
children.definition: The study of international veterinary practice and its development in specialist areas.

children.name: Animal sciences not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Animal Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

The scientific study of animals, their nutrition, treatment and care. Includes the study of animals鈥?diseases and their cure. May include veterinary nursing. Also may include the study of drugs, their characteristics, actions and uses.

children.name: Agriculture
Arable & fruit farming
Agricultural pests & diseases
children.definition: The study of diseases in crops and the animals and insects which attack them, with the object of preventing such disease or attack.

children.name: Crop physiology
children.definition: The study of crop structure and how it is affected by disease. Studies include dissection and use of microscope slides. Also includes study at cellular level.

children.name: Crop nutrition
children.definition: The study of the process of assimilating nutrient materials into crop tissue with the aim of understanding and providing the correct nutrient balance.

children.name: Crop protection
children.definition: The particular study of the development of immunities in crops. Also includes the study of artificial barriers, preventatives or exterminators for the animals/insects which attack crops.

children.name: Crop production
children.definition: The study of growing and harvesting crops and the relationship of arable production to its environment and humans.

children.name: Glasshouse culture
children.definition: The study of native and non-native plant propagation and growth in greenhouse conditions, including crops and plants grown for their appearance or other properties.

children.name: Amenity horticulture
children.definition: The study of plants grown for their appearance for use in municipal and other large area planting schemes, gardens, parks and landscapes.

children.name: Exotic plants & crops
children.definition: The study of the most efficient way to plant, sow and harvest non-native crops.
The study of the most efficient way to grow crops on a large scale, including those borne on trees, for food.

children.name: Livestock
Livestock husbandry
children.definition: The study of animals and their relationship with their environment and people in order to enable successful farming.

children.name: Equine studies
children.definition: The particular study of horses, their health, livery and use as farm, domestic and recreational animals.

children.name: Poultry keeping
children.definition: The study of egg and fowl production and the relationship of poultry to its environment and people.

children.name: Game keeping
children.definition: The study of the breeding, maintenance and protection of wild animals preserved specifically for hunting purposes.

children.name: Exotic livestock
children.definition: The study of the most efficient way to keep, rear and breed animals not native to Britain.
The study of the most efficient way to keep animals for agricultural use rather than as pets.

children.name: Fish farming
Fish husbandry
children.definition: The study of fish in their environment for fishing or fish farming.

children.name: Freshwater fish
children.definition: The study of fish generic to unsalted ponds, streams, rivers and lakes, their habits, breeding patterns and the unique effects of their environment.

children.name: Saltwater fish
children.definition: The study of fish generic to seas, oceans and salted estuaries, their habits, breeding patterns and the unique effects of their environment.

children.name: Ornamental fish
children.definition: The study of fish kept for recreational purposes, their habits and breeding patterns.

children.name: Aquaculture
children.definition: The study of the cultivation of water resources, both plant and animal, for human consumption or use.
The study of the most efficient way to use an area of water to rear fish for commercial sale.

children.name: Rural estate management
Farm management
children.definition: The study of the most efficient way to keep livestock and grow and harvest crops and fruit. Includes home farm management.

children.name: Game keeping management
children.definition: The study of the habitat and management of land set aside for hunting purposes.

children.name: Water resource management
children.definition: The study of fresh and salt water, its use commercially, domestically and recreationally. Includes the conservation of water. Also includes the study of drought, flood and the water cycle.

children.name: Land management for recreation
children.definition: The study of land used for informal recreation. Includes study of erosion and damage to habitat from over or inappropriate use, and the techniques to prevent, cure and minimise such damage.

children.name: Biological heritage site management
children.definition: The scientific study of the conservation of land which has or contains something of rarity value; Sites of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI) and the species found there.

children.name: Wilderness management
children.definition: The study of the conservation of wild, uninhabited and uncultivated land for aesthetic, recreational or scientific purposes.

children.name: Environmental conservation
children.definition: The study of the protection and careful management of natural resources and the environment.

children.name: Sustainable agricultural & landscape development
children.definition: The study of agricultural and other related landscape uses with particular emphasis on sustainable and environmentally sensitive practices.
The study of the administration of large landed properties as or on behalf of their owner. Includes elements of business studies, personnel management, buildings management.

children.name: International agriculture
children.definition: The study of the science or occupation of cultivating land and rearing crops in various parts of the world.

children.name: Organic farming
Organic arable & fruit farming
children.definition: The study of the most efficient way to grow crops on a large scale, including those borne on trees, for food, without the use of artificial chemicals or fertilisers.

children.name: Organic livestock
children.definition: The study of the most efficient way to keep animals for agricultural use rather than as pets without the use of artificial chemicals or feed.

children.name: Organic fish farming
children.definition: The study of the most efficient way to use an area of water to rear fish for commercial sale, without the use of artificial chemicals.
The study of agricultural processes conducted without the use of artificial chemicals in the form of fertilisers or pesticides.

children.name: Agricultural technology
Agricultural machinery
children.definition: The study of the use and maintenance of agricultural machinery. Includes the study of tractors, hedge clippers, milking machines etc.

children.name: Agricultural irrigation & drainage
children.definition: The study of the control of water by means of artificial canals and ditches, mechanical pumps, weather stations etc.
The study of practical or mechanical sciences connected with agriculture as they apply to increased efficiency, economy and crop production.

children.name: Agriculture not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Agriculture categories. To be used sparingly.

The study of farming and husbandry, conservation, rural business studies and related applied sciences. Includes study and practical experience of cultivating land and rearing crops and livestock. May also include some aspects of rural recreation.

children.name: Forestry & arboriculture
Trees & shrubs
Forestry pests & diseases
children.definition: The study of diseases in commercially-grown hardwood and softwood trees and the animals and insects which attack them, with the object of preventing such disease or attack.

children.name: Tree physiology
children.definition: The study of hardwood and softwood tree structure and how it is affected by disease. Studies include dissection and use of microscope slides. Also includes study at cellular level.

children.name: Tree nutrition
children.definition: The study of the process of assimilating nutrient materials into tree tissue with the aim of understanding and providing the correct balance.

children.name: Tree protection
children.definition: The particular study of the development of immunities in trees. Also includes the study of artificial barriers, preventative measures or exterminators for the animals/insects which attack them.

children.name: Tree production
children.definition: The study of growing and harvesting trees and the relationship of such tree production to its environment.

children.name: Timber production
children.definition: The study of hardwood and softwood timber products. May include the different uses of wood products. May also include the suitability of certain trees for certain uses.

children.name: Community forestry
children.definition: The study of forestry used for recreation. Includes study of formal and informal recreational uses, erosion and damage to habitat from over or inappropriate use, and the techniques to prevent, cure and minimise such damage.
The study of the most efficient way to grow hardwood and softwood trees for harvesting.

children.name: International forestry
children.definition: The study of the science or occupation of cultivating trees as a crop in various parts of the world.

children.name: Organic forestry
children.definition: The study of forestry processes conducted without the use of artificial chemicals in the form of fertilisers or pesticides.

children.name: Forestry technology
Forestry irrigation & drainage
children.definition: The study of the control of water and prevention of erosion by means of good planting, mechanical pumps etc.
The study of practical or mechanical sciences connected with forestry as they apply to increased efficiency, economy and crop production.

children.name: Forestry not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Forestry categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of planting and caring for trees and the management of woods and forests for conservation purposes, commercial exploitation and recreational use.

children.name: Food & beverage studies
Food science
Meat science
children.definition: The study of the properties of meat. Includes the application of food sciences to meat-inclusive food systems.

children.name: Cereal science
children.definition: The study of the properties of cereal and grains. Includes the application of food sciences to cereal-inclusive food systems.

children.name: Vegetable science
children.definition: The study of the properties of vegetables. Includes the application of food sciences to vegetable-inclusive food systems.

children.name: Fruit science
children.definition: The study of the properties of fruit. Includes the application of food sciences to fruit-inclusive food systems.
The study of the properties and behaviour of food. Includes the application of physical, chemical and biological sciences to food systems.

children.name: Food hygiene
children.definition: The study of the maintenance and promotion of health through the clean and sanitary handling of food.

children.name: Food & beverage production
Food & beverage manufacture
children.definition: The study of the development of artificial foodstuffs. Includes the substitution of one type of food for another.

children.name: Food & beverage processing
children.definition: The study of the preservation and processing of foodstuffs.

children.name: Food & beverage technology
children.definition: The study of the production techniques for food and drink. Includes study of resources and environmental concerns.

children.name: Industrial baking
children.definition: The study of the production of cooked foodstuffs. Includes the application of physical, chemical and biological sciences to food preparation.

children.name: Industrial brewing
children.definition: The study of the production of liquid beverages. Includes the application of physical, chemical and biological sciences to drink preparation.
The study of the process of supplying food and drink. Includes study of production techniques and the amount and rate at which foodstuffs are produced.

children.name: Food & beverages for the consumer
Food & beverage packaging
children.definition: The study of packaging and packaging systems to ensure economic and hygienic handling and customer satisfaction.

children.name: Food & beverage delivery
children.definition: The study of transportation of food and drink to ensure economic and hygienic handling and customer satisfaction.
The study of food products and their preparation to attract consumers.

children.name: Food & beverage studies not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Food and Beverage studies categories. To be used sparingly.

The study of the properties and behaviour of food from the point of origin on the farm (or elsewhere), through different stages of storage, transportation, preservation or other transformations, including domestic or restaurant food preparation procedures, to its use by the consumer.

children.name: Agricultural sciences
Agricultural biology
Agricultural microbiology
children.definition: The scientific study of micro-organisms encompassing major components of genetics and molecular biology, with particular emphasis on their use in or effect on agricultural processes. Includes bacteriology, virology, cell structure and function and may include some immunology.
A scientific study of living organisms, both animal and vegetable with particular emphasis on their use in or effect on agricultural processes.

children.name: Agricultural chemistry
Agricultural biochemistry
children.definition: The scientific study of the chemical compounds and reactions occurring in the cells and molecules of living organisms with particular emphasis on their use in or effect on agricultural processes. Involves aspects of cellular organisation and specialisation and how the structure and function of DNA, RNA, proteins, enzymes and membranes determine biological processes.
The particular study of how individual atoms and molecules react together naturally and/or synthetically to affect agricultural processes.

children.name: Agricultural botany
children.definition: The particular study of plants cultivated as a crop. Includes their classification, structure, physiology, ecology and economic importance.

children.name: Agricultural zoology
children.definition: The scientific study of all agriculture-related aspects of animal biology. Includes their reproduction, development, physiology, behaviour, diseases and interactions with their environment.

children.name: Soil as an agricultural medium
children.definition: The study of the physical, chemical and biological processes which explain soil behaviour.

children.name: Agricultural sciences not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Agricultural Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.
The specifically scientific study of aspects of agriculture, excluding wider non-laboratory-based agricultural subjects such as economics, business management and land use.

children.name: Others in veterinary sciences, agriculture & related subjects
Veterinary sciences, agriculture & related subjects not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Veterinary Sciences, Agriculture and related subjects categories. To be used sparingly.
Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Veterinary Sciences, Agriculture and related subjects categories. To be used sparingly.
N/A

children.name: Physical Sciences
Chemistry
Applied chemistry
Industrial chemistry
children.definition: The study of chemical processes of industrial significance.

children.name: Colour chemistry
children.definition: The chemical science of dyes and pigments.
Topics in chemistry of commercial or social importance.

children.name: Inorganic chemistry
children.definition: The study of inorganic elements, compounds and reaction mechanisms.

children.name: Structural chemistry
Crystallography
children.definition: The study and application of techniques for determining crystal structure.
Determination and analysis of chemical structures.

children.name: Environmental chemistry
Marine chemistry
children.definition: Topics in the chemical sciences concerned with understanding the marine environment.
Concerned with environmental issues related to the chemical sciences.

children.name: Medicinal chemistry
Pharmaceutical chemistry
children.definition: The study of drug function.
Aspects of Chemistry, such as drug design, of importance to medical science.

children.name: Organic chemistry
Organometallic chemistry
children.definition: The study of reactions between organic compounds and metals.

children.name: Polymer chemistry
children.definition: The study of the properties of macromolecular compounds and their synthesis.

children.name: Bio-organic chemistry
children.definition: The study of natural organic compounds.

children.name: Petrochemical chemistry
children.definition: The chemical science of petroleum and petroleum compounds.

children.name: Biomolecular chemistry
children.definition: The chemical science of biological materials at the molecular level.
The study of organic compounds and their reaction mechanisms.

children.name: Physical chemistry
children.definition: The study of atomic and molecular structure, chemical bonding, energetics and dynamics.

children.name: Analytical chemistry
children.definition: The study of chemical and instrumental analysis.

children.name: Chemistry not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Chemistry categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of individual atoms and molecules and the way they react together naturally and synthetically.

children.name: Materials science
Materials science not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Materials Science categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the crystalline and granular structure of materials, including electronic atomic and molecular configurations. May include the study of mining and mining techniques.

children.name: Physics
Applied physics
Engineering physics
children.definition: Physical principles and techniques applied to engineering and technology.
Topics in physics of commercial or social importance.

children.name: Chemical physics
Solid-state physics
children.definition: Study of the structure of solids and the explanation of their properties.
Concerned with central area of physical science, integrating chemistry and physics.

children.name: Environmental physics
Atmospheric physics
children.definition: The study of the Earth's stratosphere, troposphere and upper atmosphere including atmospheric kinetics and water in the atmosphere.

children.name: Marine physics
children.definition: The study of the physical properties of the marine environment.
Aspects of physics concerned with environmental issues.

children.name: Mathematical & theoretical physics
Electromagnetism
children.definition: The study of the interaction of charges in electromagnetic fields.

children.name: Quantum mechanics
children.definition: Description and analysis of sub-atomic behaviour.

children.name: Computational physics
children.definition: Numerical and quantitative methods in physics.
The mathematical principles and techniques of physics theory and explanation of physical phenomena.

children.name: Medical physics
Radiation physics
children.definition: Monitoring and evaluation of emissions from sources of radiation.
The application of Physics to the medical sciences.

children.name: Optical physics
Laser physics
children.definition: The study of lasers as optical instrumentation.
The study of optics as a natural phenomenon and optical instrumentation.

children.name: Nuclear & particle physics
children.definition: The study of matter at atomic and sub-atomic level, and of the structure and behaviour of nuclei.

children.name: Acoustics
children.definition: The study of the propagation and transmission of sound waves.

children.name: Physics not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Physics categories. To be used sparingly.

The study of the properties of matter and energy and the relationships between them, making extensive use of mathematical techniques and models. May include mechanics, optics, electricity, magnetism and acoustics. May also include atomic, nuclear, particle and solid state studies.

children.name: Forensic & archaeological sciences
Forensic science
children.definition: The application of Forensic Science in evaluating evidence in courts of law. The techniques used include fingerprinting (both traditional and genetic), analysis of blood and poison samples, ballistics etc.

children.name: Archaeological science
children.definition: The study of the scientific analysis of the material remains of past cultures. Includes an approach to reconstruct and understand the past. Also includes the application of physical, chemical and biological techniques to aid scientific, archaeological and geoarchaeological investigations.

children.name: Forensic & archaeological sciences not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Forensic and Archaeological Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.
The specifically scientific study of materials involved in investigative procedures. May necessitate the study of chemical processes and other scientific techniques including archaeological sciences.

children.name: Astronomy
Astrophysics
children.definition: The study of the physical nature of the universe including cosmology and astronomical techniques.

children.name: Space & planetary sciences
Space science
children.definition: The physical science study of space beyond the solar system.

children.name: Planetary science
children.definition: The study of the physical science of the solar system including the measurement of the Earth and its gravitational field.
The study of the solar system and evaluation of physical measurements from space.

children.name: Solar & solar terrestrial physics
children.definition: The study of the sun and the interaction of the sun with the Earth.

children.name: Astronomy observation
children.definition: The study of astronomy utilising observational techniques to undertake research.

children.name: Astronomy theory
children.definition: The study of the theoretical aspects of astronomy.

children.name: Astronomy not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Astronomy categories. To be used sparingly.
The specifically scientific study of celestial bodies. Includes mathematics, statistics, physics, photography and computing.

children.name: Geology
Applied geology
Industrial geology
children.definition: The study of geological processes of industrial significance.

children.name: Engineering geology
children.definition: Geological structures and processes in an engineering context.
Topics in geology of commercial or social importance.

children.name: Mining geology

Geological topics related to the mining and minerals industry.

children.name: Geotechnology
Marine geotechnology
children.definition: The study of geotechnical processes in marine environments.
The study of the principles and applications of geotechnical engineering. Includes aspects of civil engineering and the construction and extraction industries.

children.name: Earth science

children.definition: The study of the fossil record.

children.name: Geoscience
children.definition: The study of the earth sciences, including geological chemistry and physics.

children.name: Geohazards
children.definition: The study of the rock systems of the most recent geological period.

children.name: Geophysics
children.definition: The study of the physical, chemical and biological processes which occur at the interface between rock and water at or below the Earth's surface at all scales. Includes water-related geological processes beneath oceans, aquifers, groundwater resources and the response of aquifers to environmental change.

children.name: Geochemistry
children.definition: The study of the processes which determine the behaviour and composition of the Earth's mantle and core.

children.name: Quaternary studies
children.definition: The study of the quantification and modelling of the fluxes and transformations of material and energy between the land (including the biosphere) and the atmosphere. Includes the variability of these interactions in time and space.
The study of the earth as a unified system; includes earth resources, surface and crustal processes.

children.name: Petrology
children.definition: The study of the sedimentary processes including deposition and dynamics in the oceans.

children.name: Stratigraphy
children.definition: The study of the physical structure and dynamics of the earth.

children.name: Geology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Geology categories. To be used sparingly.

The study of the origin, history, structure and composition of the earth. Encourages understanding of environmental problems and includes techniques on searching for mineral resources and other raw materials.

Physical oceanography
children.definition: The study of the coastal environment and mariculture.

children.name: Chemical oceanography

children.name: Biological oceanography

children.definition: N/A

children.name: Metallurgy
Applied metallurgy
children.definition: Topics in metallurgy of commercial or social importance.

children.name: Metallic fabrication
Pattern making
children.definition: The precision cutting of metals for use in the production of objects and structures.
The processes involved in the production and manufacture of metallic objects and structures.

children.name: Corrosion technology
children.definition: The study and control of the corrosion of metals.

children.name: Metallurgy not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Metallurgy categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the principles of minerals technology as they apply to the structure and properties of metals, their extraction, refining, alloys and manufacture. Involves practical element.

children.name: Ceramics & glass
Ceramics
children.definition: The study of the principles of minerals technology as they apply to ceramics. Stresses the use of the raw material rather than how it is extracted.

children.name: Glass technology
children.definition: The study of the principles of minerals technology as they apply to glass and glass derivatives. Stresses the use of the raw material rather than how it is extracted.

children.name: Ceramics & glass not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Ceramics and Glass categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the principles of minerals technology as they apply to clay and clay-based products. Stresses the use of the raw material rather than how it is extracted.

children.name: Polymers & textiles
Polymers technology
Plastics
children.definition: The use and development of plastics.
The use and development of polymers.

children.name: Textiles technology
Textile chemistry
children.definition: The development of textiles from chemical compounds.

children.name: Dying & colouring of textiles
children.definition: The study of dying and colouring agents and their application to textiles.
The use and development of textiles.

children.name: Leather technology
Tanning
children.definition: The conversion of raw hide into leather.
The study of the processing and use of leather. Includes tanning and methods of preserving leather.

children.name: Clothing production
Machine knitting
children.definition: The study of the programming and operation of knitting machines.

children.name: Commercial tailoring
children.definition: The making and adaptation of clothing to specific measurements.

children.name: Pattern cutting
children.definition: The design and cutting of patterns from cloth.

children.name: Millinery
children.definition: The design and production of hats.

children.name: Footwear production
children.definition: The design and production of footwear.
The study of the methods and processes used in the production of clothing.

children.name: Polymers & textiles not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Polymers and Textiles categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of molecular compounds or filaments. Stresses the use of the raw material rather than how it is extracted.

children.name: Materials technology not otherwise specified
Materials technology
Engineering materials
children.definition: The processing, storage and production of materials used in engineering.

children.name: Paper technology
children.definition: The processing, storage and production of paper and paper-based materials.

children.name: Furniture technology
children.definition: The processing, storage and production of materials used in furniture making.
The processing, storage and production of materials.

children.name: Printing

children.definition: The study of the processes involved in offset lithographic printing.

children.name: Photo-lithography
children.definition: The study of the processes involved in photo-lithography.

children.name: Reprographic techniques
children.definition: The study of the processes involved in reprographics.

children.name: Screen process printing
children.definition: The study of the processes involved in screen process printing.
The study of the processes involved in printing.

children.name: Gemmology
children.definition: The processing, cutting and polishing of precious stones.

children.name: Materials technology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other, specified, Materials Technology categories. To be used sparingly.

children.name: Maritime technology
Marine technology
Marine navigation
children.definition: The study of the specific processes involved in marine navigation.

children.name: Marine radar
children.definition: The use of radar in boats, ships and other marine craft.

children.name: Marine radio
children.definition: The use of radio and telecommunications systems in boats, ships and other marine craft.

children.name: Marine plumbing
children.definition: The use of plumbing systems in boats, ships and other marine craft.
The processes and systems used in boats, ships and other marine craft.
