children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Maritime Technology categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of practical or mechanical sciences connected with the sea, involving marine technology, as it applies to industry or commerce.

children.name: Biotechnology
Plant biotechnology (crops, trees, shrubs etc.)
children.definition: Involves the molecular and microbial manipulation of plants.

children.name: Animal biotechnology
children.definition: Involves the molecular and microbial manipulation of animals.

children.name: Environmental biotechnology
children.definition: The integration of sciences and engineering in order to utilise the biochemical potential of microorganisms, plants and parts thereof for the restoration and preservation of the environment and for the sustainable use of resources.

children.name: Industrial biotechnology
children.definition: The use of plants, microorganisms and their constituent molecular and biochemical components for use in potentially large-scale applications in industry.

children.name: Medical biotechnology
children.definition: Biotechnology as applied to the development of human/veterinary diagnostic, therapeutic systems. Not Medical Technology.

children.name: Biotechnology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Industrial Biotechnology categories. To be used sparingly.

The use of biological processes or organisms for the production of materials and services. Biotechnology includes the use of techniques for the improvement of the characteristics of economically important plants and animals and for the development of micro-organisms to act on the environment.

children.name: Others in technology
Energy technologies
children.definition: Technologies involved in the production, transmission and storage of energy.

children.name: Ergonomics
children.definition: The study of the efficiency and effectiveness of the interface between people and machines.

children.name: Audio technology
Music recording
children.definition: The study of/training in the techniques required to obtain accurate and lifelike recordings of musical performances.
The study of the systems and processes used in the manipulation and amplification of sound. Includes the recording of sound and/or music.

children.name: Machinery maintenance
Office machinery maintenance
children.definition: The techniques and skills involved in the routine maintenance of office machinery.

children.name: Industrial machinery maintenance
children.definition: The techniques and skills involved in the routine maintenance of industrial machinery.
The techniques and skills involved in the routine maintenance of machines.

children.name: Musical instrument technology
children.definition: The study of the systems and processes used in the manufacture of musical instruments.

children.name: Transport logistics
children.definition: The study of the optimal methods of mass distribution services.

children.name: Emergency & disaster technologies
children.definition: The study of technical responses to emergencies and disasters.

children.name: Technologies not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the Others in Technology categories. To be used sparingly.
Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Technologies categories. To be used sparingly.
N/A

children.name: Architecture, Building and Planning
Architecture
Architectural design theory
children.definition: Design of buildings for human activity, taking into account both internal and external environmental factors.

children.name: Interior architecture
children.definition: The study of enclosed spaces; design, implementation and materials.

children.name: Architectural technology
children.definition: The theory and practice of advanced techniques and new materials in architectural design and construction.

children.name: Architecture not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Architecture categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the design, construction and erection of structures. Combines design creativity with technical competence.

children.name: Building
Building technology
children.definition: The understanding of building design and its relationship with production.

children.name: Construction management
children.definition: The implementation of construction projects to the client's specification from inception to completion.

children.name: Building surveying
children.definition: The analysis of a building's performance from design and construction, through to maintenance and repair.

children.name: Quantity surveying
children.definition: The financial management of project design and construction, whether for client or contractor.

children.name: Conservation of buildings
Property development
children.definition: The practical and theoretical study of property that is to be improved or altered in some way from its original purpose, or to be modernised or expanded within its current purpose.
The repair, restoration and preservation of old or damaged and/or culturally significant buildings including conservation technology.

children.name: Building not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Building categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of building materials and techniques. Includes building and environment law and economics, architectural engineering and quantity surveying.

children.name: Landscape & Garden Design
Landscape architecture
children.definition: The study of the planning, design, construction and management of large land-based spaces within the context of human activity in the urban or natural environment.

children.name: Landscape studies
children.definition: The planning and management of the built and natural environment as landscape.

children.name: Landscape design
children.definition: The study of the design, construction and management of domestic land-based space and scenery. Includes buildings within the landscape and the habitat surrounding them.

children.name: Garden design
Garden horticulture
children.definition: The study of horticulture with specific reference to public and private gardens.
The study of the design, construction and management of public and private gardens.

children.name: Landscape & garden design not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Landscape & garden design categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the design, construction and management of land-based space and scenery.

children.name: Planning (urban, rural & regional)
Regional planning
children.definition: The preparation of strategic plans for the development of a region.

children.name: Urban & rural planning
Urban planning
children.definition: The planning of the infrastructure, development and management of settlement in towns.

children.name: Rural planning
children.definition: The planning of the infrastructure, development and management of settlement in the country.
The planning of the infrastructure and development of settlements, including new towns and the management of change.

children.name: Planning studies
children.definition: Reconciliation of the dynamics of the economic, environmental and social effects in the planning context.

children.name: Urban studies
children.definition: The interaction of the planning process and management policies on the built environment.

children.name: Housing
children.definition: The development and management of housing projects in the private and social sectors and in land use planning.

children.name: Transport planning
children.definition: The development and management of transportation systems.

children.name: Planning (urban, rural & regional) not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Planning (Urban, Rural and Regional) categories. To be used sparingly.

children.name: Others in architecture, building & planning
Architecture, building & planning not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the Others in Architecture, Building and Planning categories. To be used sparingly.

children.name: Social Studies
Economics
Applied economics
Financial economics
children.definition: The study of the application of economic principles and analytical techniques in the area of finance.

children.name: Agricultural economics
children.definition: The study of the application of economic principles and analytical techniques in the area of agriculture.

children.name: Economic policy
children.definition: The study of the application of economic principles and analytical techniques in the area of government policy.
The study of the application of economic principles and analytical techniques to the study of particular industries, activities or the exploitation of particular resources.

children.name: Microeconomics
children.definition: The study of the branch of economics concerned with particular commodities, firms or individuals and the economic relationships between them.

children.name: Macroeconomics
children.definition: The study of the economic environment within which firms and individuals may operate.

children.name: Econometrics
children.definition: The study of the systematic mathematical and statistical analysis of economic phenomena and problems.

children.name: Political economics
children.definition: The study of the branch of economics which deals with the economic implications of political policy.

children.name: International economics
children.definition: The systematic study and analysis of international commercial behaviour and trade policy.

children.name: Economic systems
Capitalism
children.definition: The study of the economic system which is based upon the private ownership of the means of production, distribution and exchange.

children.name: Monetarism
children.definition: The study of the system based upon the theory that an economy can be regulated by means of central control of the money supply.

children.name: Keynesianism
children.definition: The system based upon the idea that governments can manage economies by influencing the level of aggregate demand.

children.name: Collectivism
children.definition: The study of the system based upon the principle of ownership of the means of production, distribution and exchange by the state, or the people.
The study of economic systems based upon particular doctrines.

children.name: Economics not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Economics categories. To be used sparingly.
The systematic study of the production, conservation and allocation of resources in conditions of scarcity, together with the organisational frameworks related to these processes.

children.name: Politics
Political theories
Liberalism
children.definition: Political doctrine that emphasises the freedom of the individual and individual rights while minimising the need for external constraints.

children.name: Conservatism
children.definition: Political doctrine that emphasises the need for ordered control of society through the organisation of the state and the upholding of existing traditions and values.

children.name: Socialism
children.definition: Political doctrine that espouses social organisation of society based on co-operation, collectivism, egalitarianism and the communal ownership of the means of production.

children.name: Nationalism
children.definition: Political doctrine that promotes the self-determination of the nation.

children.name: Fascism
children.definition: Political doctrine that emphasises the dominance and the hierarchical authoritarian organisation of the state.

children.name: Feminism
children.definition: Political doctrine that highlights and attempts to reverse any inequalities in society based on gender differences.

children.name: Environmentalism
children.definition: Political doctrine that believes that human life can only be understood in the context of the natural world and that progress lies in the preservation of the natural environment.

children.name: Anarchism
children.definition: Political doctrine that advocates the abolition of central authority so that a more natural social order can develop.
Collections of ideas that seek to explain the organisation of society and/or resolve conflicts within society.

children.name: Political systems
Autocracy
children.definition: The system of government that embodies the rule of an individual with unrestricted authority.

children.name: Democracy
children.definition: The system of government based on the consent of the governed.

children.name: Plutocracy
children.definition: The system of government that embodies the rule of the wealthy.

children.name: Oligarchy
children.definition: The system of government that embodies the rule of the few over the many.
The study of the organisation and functions of various methods of government.

children.name: UK government/parliamentary studies
Public administration
children.definition: The study of the functions and structure of those bodies concerned with the administrative duties of government.

children.name: UK constitutional studies
children.definition: The examination of the nature, content, implications and role of the UK constitution in the UK system of government.
The examination of the structure and function of the UK system of government.

children.name: International politics
European Union politics
children.definition: The study of the structures, functions and theories of politics within the European Union.

children.name: Commonwealth politics
children.definition: The study of the structures, functions and theories of politics within the Commonwealth.

children.name: Politics of a specific country/region
children.definition: The study of the structures, functions and theories of politics within a specific country or region.

children.name: International constitutional studies
children.definition: The examination of the nature, content, implications and role of constitutions in international systems of government.
The study of political structures, functions and theories among the international community.

children.name: International relations
Strategic studies
children.definition: The study of strategies designed to promote and defend the autonomy and interests of a country within the international community.

children.name: War & peace studies
children.definition: The examination of the procedures and processes that contribute to war or peace.

children.name: International criminology
children.definition: The study of the interaction between members of the international criminal justice community.
The study of the interaction between members of the international community.

children.name: Comparative politics
children.definition: The comparative study of differing political structures, political functions and political theories.

children.name: Politics not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Politics categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of activities related to the institution of the state and the machinery of government or the method through which social conflict is expressed and attempts to resolve conflict are made.

children.name: Sociology
Applied sociology
Applied criminology
children.definition: The study of the application of criminological principles and techniques to particular social institutions, relationships or problems.

children.name: Victimology
children.definition: The study of the conceptualisation and role of the victim within the criminal justice system.
The study of the application of sociological principles and techniques to particular social institutions or types of social relationship.

children.name: Gender studies
Women's studies

children.name: Men's studies
children.definition: The study of the role and influence of men in society.
The study of the sociological influence of gender.

children.name: Ethnic studies
children.definition: The study of the sociological influence of ethnicity.

children.name: Disability in society
children.definition: The study of the sociological influence of disability.

children.name: Religion in society
children.definition: The study of the sociological influence of religion.

children.name: Socio-economics

children.name: Social theory
Social hierarchy

children.name: Political sociology

children.name: Sociology not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Sociology categories. To be used sparingly.

children.name: Sociology of science & technology

children.name: Social policy
UK social policy

children.name: International social policy
children.definition: The study of the policies of international institutions which are designed to modify the balance of sociological factors.

children.name: Public policy
Health policy

children.name: Welfare policy

children.name: Education policy
children.definition: The study of policies implemented by local and central governments to provide for the educational needs of society.

children.name: Transport policy
children.definition: The study of policies implemented by local and central governments to provide for the transportation needs of society.

children.name: Security policy
children.definition: The study of policies implemented by local and central governments to uphold and defend the structure and authority of the state.

children.name: Emergency services policy
children.definition: The study of policies implemented by local and central governments to support the emergency services.

children.name: Social work
Health & welfare
children.definition: The study of Social Work services aimed at support of the health and welfare of vulnerable/under-privileged individuals and/or groups.

children.name: Child care
children.definition: The study of Social Work services aimed at support of vulnerable/under-privileged children in society.

children.name: Youth work
children.definition: The study of Social Work services aimed at support of vulnerable/under-privileged youths in society.

children.name: Community work
Community justice

The study of Social Work services aimed at support of vulnerable/under-privileged people within particular communities in society.

children.name: Careers guidance

children.name: Probation/after-care

children.name: Social work not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Social Work categories. To be used sparingly.

Social & cultural anthropology
Criminological theory

children.name: Physical & biological anthropology

children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Anthropology categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of human beings, their antecedents and related primates, and their cultural behaviour and institutions, in comparative perspective.

children.name: Human & social geography of Asia

children.name: Human & social geography of Africa
children.definition: The systematic study of the spatial distribution and interrelationships of people, natural resources, plant and animal life in the African continent.

children.name: Human & social geography of Australasia

children.name: Human & social geography of the Americas

The systematic study of the spatial distribution and interrelationships of people, natural resources, plant and animal life in a particular area.

children.name: Agricultural geography

The study of particular topics within Human and Social Geography.

children.name: Human & social geography not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Human and Social Geography categories. To be used sparingly.
The systematic study of the spatial distribution and interrelationships of people, natural resources, plant and animal life.

children.name: Others in social studies
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Social studies categories. To be used sparingly.

children.name: Social studies not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the Others in Social studies categories. To be used sparingly.

The study of the specific techniques required for the management of specific types of institutions.

Land management

children.definition: The techniques involved in the management of buildings and other structures.

The techniques involved in the management of land, buildings and similar physical resources.

Emergency services management
children.definition: The specific techniques involved in the management of emergency services.

children.name: Visual communication
children.definition: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques in design to impart information.
The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques effectively to communicate ideas and information to business and consumer audiences via forms of printed media.

children.name: Illustration
children.definition: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques effectively to communicate ideas and information to business and consumer audiences via drawn or painted images.

children.name: Clothing/fashion design
Textile design
children.definition: The study of/training in the design of textiles.
The study of/training in the design and use of textiles and other materials to create items of apparel.

children.name: Industrial/product design
children.definition: The study of/training in the design of industrial and consumer products to meet aesthetic, functional and commercial requirements.

children.name: Interior design
children.definition: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques in the planning, designing, equipping and furnishing of residential, commercial and public interior spaces.

children.name: Furniture design
children.definition: The study of/training in the design of furniture for residential, commercial and public environments.

children.name: Ceramics design
children.definition: The study of/training in the design of ceramic artefacts.

children.name: Interactive & electronic design
children.definition: The study of/training in the design of non-static computer-generated images.

children.name: Design studies not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Design studies categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of design for everyday objects, taking into account technology and commerce as well as appearance and current art thinking. May involve the use of computers as design tools.

children.name: Music
Musicianship/performance studies
Instrumental or vocal performance
children.definition: The study of performance in relation to various genres of music, theatre and performing arts (concert, recital, play, ballet, operetta, circus acts, poetry).

children.name: Musical theatre
children.definition: The study of the definition and styles of music within the theatrical arena.

children.name: Conducting
children.definition: The study of directing musical performance by way of visible gestures.

children.name: Jazz performance
children.definition: The study of performance in the jazz genre. The preparation of individuals to master the performance of jazz. Includes instruction in improvisation, jazz instrument and ensemble performance.

children.name: Popular music performance
children.definition: The study of performance in the genre of music classified as popular music, providing excellent creative opportunities for performers.

children.name: Electronic/electro-acoustic music performance
children.definition: The study of performance in the genre of music classified as electronic and electro-acoustic music, using the principles and techniques of electronic sound manipulation and computer applications.

children.name: Historical performance practice
children.definition: The study of historical interpretation, utilising period instruments and gaining insight into traditional approaches and original sources.
The study of/training in the mastering of musical instruments and performing art as solo and/or ensemble performers.

children.name: Music education/teaching
children.definition: The study associated with the teaching and learning of music, developing music skills and appreciation.

children.name: History of music
children.definition: The study of the historical development of music and musical styles.

children.name: Types of music
Popular music
children.definition: The study of popular music that is accessible to the general public and disseminated by one or more of the mass media.

children.name: Film music/screen music
children.definition: The analytical study of film/screen music including techniques of musical style and composition for the moving image.

children.name: Jazz
children.definition: The study of music classified as in the style of jazz. Includes instruction in the history of jazz and jazz theory.

children.name: Folk music
children.definition: The study of music classified as in the style of folk music exploring its traditional and revived forms.

children.name: Opera
children.definition: The study of music classified as opera, including the theatrical, musical and literary techniques used by composers when creating new works.

children.name: Sacred music
children.definition: The study of the use of music in the church and the role of music in worship and other world religions.
The study of specific types and variants of musical genres.

children.name: Musicology
Ethnomusicology/world music
children.definition: The study of music and dance from all parts of the world, focusing on the systematic study of the forms and methods of music art, and the functions of music, in Western and non-Western societies and cultures.

children.name: Community music
children.definition: The study of music in everyday life and the development of the professional and critical skills required in community-based music making, including the facilitating of community music projects.

children.name: Music & gender
children.definition: The study of music relating to a specific gender.

children.name: Philosophy, aesthetics & criticism of music
children.definition: The study of the nature, quality and beauty of music and our evaluation, interpretation and enjoyment of music and its performance.

children.name: Music psychology
children.definition: The study of psychological theory and methods to interpret and understand musical behaviours, sounds and ideas.

children.name: Music theory & analysis
children.definition: The study of conceptual structures typical of music theory and method and techniques used to analyse music.

children.name: Sociology of music
children.definition: The study of the relationship between music and society. Concerned with the function of music in society and the ways in which society influences the development of music.
The systematic study of the forms and methods of music art, and the functions of music in societies and cultures.

children.name: Musical instrument history
children.definition: Historical studies of the development of musical instruments in the context of changing styles of playing and performance.

children.name: Music technology & industry
Sound design/commercial music recording
children.definition: The study of the concepts of sound recording and reproduction through electronic means, including all aspects of recording within the music industry.

children.name: Creative music technology
children.definition: The study of the conceptually creative uses of computer-based music and the latest development of technical skills involved in the music business.

children.name: Electro-acoustic studies
children.definition: The study of the production, transmission, and reception of sounds by the human voice and various instruments for electronic sound system design, integration and digital acoustical consulting.

children.name: Music production
children.definition: The study of music and audio production techniques relating to commercial trends and current technologies to control recording sessions and supervising the recording, mixing and mastering processes.

children.name: Music management/music industry management/arts management
children.definition: The study of managing music organisations, operations, facilities, and personnel. Includes instruction in business and financial management, music law and applications to specific activities such as managing theatres, recording studios, bands and individual artists.

children.name: Music marketing
children.definition: The study of the organisation of branding, pricing and promotion of the spectrum of musical products and services. Including event promotion, music products merchandising, artist agency and promotion.
The technical aspects involved with the musical arts, particularly the use of electronic devices and music industry business practices.

children.name: Composition
Electracoustic composition/acousmatic composition
children.definition: The creation of an original piece of music in the genre of music classified as electracoustic, using the principles and techniques of electronic sound manipulation and computer applications.

children.name: Sonic arts
children.definition: The creation of an original piece of music using practices that predominantly focus on a relationship between the wide notions of the visual and aural domains of art and sound perception.

children.name: Electronic music
children.definition: The creation of an original piece of music in the genre of music classified as electronic. Includes mastering electronic music production, remixing and composition using cutting edge electronic techniques and digital music technologies.

children.name: Applied music/musicianship
children.definition: Includes traditional music theory and performance, with additional aspects of technology, community music, education, musicology and development of original creative ability.

children.name: Commercial music composition
children.definition: The creation of an original piece of music for commercial activities to be played through the medium of radio or television.

children.name: Multimedia music composition
children.definition: The creation of fusion and experimental musical forms using techniques appropriated from a combination of different interactive content forms.

children.name: Jazz composition
children.definition: The preparation of individuals to master the composition of jazz. Includes instruction in related musical styles such as Blues.

children.name: Popular music composition
children.definition: The study of the expertise of contemporary song-writing, studying musical concepts in popular music cultures and music industry practices of popular music.
The creation of a new piece of original music and structure.

children.name: Music not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Music categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of melody, harmony and rhythm produced in accordance with specified patterns and sequences. May include performance, theory and history of music.

children.name: Drama
Acting
children.definition: The study of/training in the communication of dramatic information, ideas, moods, and feelings through the achievement of naturalistic and believable behaviour in imaginary circumstances.

children.name: Directing for theatre
children.definition: The study of/training in the supervision and direction of dramatic performances.

children.name: Producing for theatre
children.definition: The study of/training in the techniques and principals involved in the production of theatrical performances other than acting and directing.

children.name: Theatre studies
Theatre & professional practice
children.definition: The preparation of individuals to apply business management principles to the management of theatres and production corporations.

children.name: Contemporary theatre
children.definition: The preparation of individuals to manage the planning, design, preparation and production of plays and other theatrical entertainment programmes.

children.name: Technical arts & special effects for theatre
children.definition: The preparation of individuals to apply special effects and techniques to the communication of dramatic information through technical theatre methods.
The study of the technical aspects of theatrical performances.

children.name: Stage management
Theatrical wardrobe design
children.definition: The study of/training in the design of costumes for theatrical performances.

children.name: Theatrical make-up
children.definition: The study of/training in the application of make-up and/or face and body paints for theatrical performances.

children.name: Technical stage management
children.definition: The preparation of individuals for technical stage management, including set design, lighting design, theatre acoustics and technical direction.
The study of the management of lighting, props, scenery and other technical items associated with theatrical performances and management of the stage.

children.name: Theatre design
Stage design
children.definition: The study of the design of sets and scenery for use in theatres, film and television.
The study of the design of theatres and theatre productions.

children.name: Performance & live arts
European/world theatre arts
children.definition: The study of overseas theatre arts, emphasising outward-looking innovative practices that are responsive to international needs.

children.name: Circus arts
children.definition: The study of the range of circus art skills to gain a high level of expertise and performing ability in a particular circus discipline such as trapeze, tightrope or juggling.

children.name: Community theatre
children.definition: The study of theatre performance and practice focusing on community and education developed through projects with people in the local community.
The study of dramatic works and their performance. Includes instruction in dramatic styles and types and the principles of organising live productions.

children.name: Drama not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Drama categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of and/or training in acting and stagecraft. May include the study of theatre management and the supervision and production of scenery, costume, lighting etc.

children.name: Dance
Choreography
children.definition: The study of/training in the arrangement and planning of staged dance.

children.name: Body awareness
children.definition: The study of the human body in relation to its capabilities in generating artistic forms in dance.

children.name: History of dance
Dance & culture
children.definition: The study of dance through the performance of one or more of the dance disciplines, including but not limited to ballet, modern, jazz and folk dance, with focus on the study and analysis of dance as a cultural phenomenon.

children.name: Community dance
children.definition: The preparation of individuals to express ideas and feelings through the performance of one or more of the dance disciplines to support, develop and initiate dance activities within communities.
The study of the development of dance in societies and cultures.

children.name: Types of dance
Ballet
children.definition: The study of ballet dance technique, including pointe, pas de deux, choreography, solo and repertory work as well as conventional academic methodology and skills.

children.name: Dance theatre
children.definition: The study of dance technical skills, dance production and criticism and creative skills needed to develop versatility, individuality and creativity as articulate dance theatre makers and scholars.

children.name: Contemporary dance
children.definition: The study of technical, creative and professional elements of contemporary dance informed by contextual and theoretical study.

children.name: Jazz dance
children.definition: The study of jazz solo and ensemble dance, jazz choreography and technique, and interpretations of specific styles.
The study of/training in the specific styles and genres of dance.

children.name: Dance performance
children.definition: The study of the advancement of creative dance performance, including the technical and artistic complexities inherent in performance.

children.name: Dance not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Dance categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of and/or training in the movement of the body, particularly in time to music. May include some study of/training in music and/or drama.

children.name: Cinematics & photography
Moving image techniques
Directing motion pictures
children.definition: The study of/training in the direction and arrangement of equipment and actors in the production of a moving image sequence.

children.name: Producing motion pictures
children.definition: The study of/training in all aspects of the production of a moving image sequence other than acting and directing.

children.name: Film & sound recording
children.definition: The study of/training in the recording of audio and video elements in the production of a moving image sequence.

children.name: Visual & audio effects
children.definition: The study of/training in the production of special visual and/or audio effects in the production of moving image sequences.

children.name: Animation techniques
children.definition: The study of/training in the particular techniques associated with the creation of the illusion of movement in a video sequence, by the filming of successive drawings or the positions of puppets.
The study of the techniques and principles associated with the production of moving image sequences.

children.name: Cinematography
children.definition: The study of the purely artistic elements of moving image sequences.

children.name: History of cinematics & photography
History of cinematics
children.definition: The study of the development of the generating of moving images.

children.name: History of photography
children.definition: The study of the development of the generating of still images.
The study of the development of moving image and still image generation.

children.name: Photography
children.definition: The study of/training in all aspects in the creation of still images on photographic film or plates.

children.name: Cinematics & photography not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Cinematics and Photography categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of all aspects of film making.

children.name: Crafts
Fabric & leather crafts
Needlecraft
children.definition: The study of crafts which draw upon the use of needles to create and decorate fabric and leather artefacts.

children.name: Dressmaking
children.definition: The study of/training in the creation of items of apparel.

children.name: Soft furnishing
children.definition: The study of/training in the creation of soft furnishing items.

children.name: Weaving
children.definition: The craft of interweaving fibres of material, such as cotton, wool etc.

children.name: Leatherwork
children.definition: The craft involved with the creation or decoration of items made from animal skin.
The study of all crafts which are based upon the source materials of fabric and leather.

children.name: Metal crafts
Silversmithing/goldsmithing
children.definition: The craft of creating artefacts using the materials of silver and gold.

children.name: Blacksmithing
children.definition: The craft of creating artefacts from iron.

children.name: Clock/watchmaking
children.definition: The craft of creating chronometers.
The study of all crafts which use metals as a source material.

children.name: Wood crafts
Carpentry/joinery
children.definition: The craft of laying-out, fabricating, erecting, installing and repairing wooden structures and fixtures.

children.name: Cabinet making
children.definition: The craft of creating items of wooden furniture.

children.name: Marquetry & inlaying
children.definition: The craft of decorating wooden items by inlaying patterns of thin layers of wood, brass, ivory etc.

children.name: Veneering
children.definition: The craft of bonding thin outer layers of wood, brass, ivory etc. to items for decorative purposes.
The study of all crafts which involve the use of wood as a source material.

children.name: Surface decoration
children.definition: The study of all crafts which involve changing the appearance of objects by adding ornament or colour to their outer layer.

children.name: Clay & stone crafts
Pottery
children.definition: The craft of creating vessels and artefacts from fired clay.

children.name: Tile making
children.definition: The craft of creating decorative and functional tiles from clay and ceramic materials.

children.name: Stone crafts
children.definition: The craft of creating decorative and functional items from stone. May include dry-stone walling.
The study of all crafts which involve the use of clay, stone and related materials.

children.name: Reed crafts
Basketry
children.definition: The craft of constructing containers from interwoven cane or reeds.

children.name: Thatching
children.definition: The study of the craft of traditional roofing using straw, reeds or similar materials.
The study of all crafts which involve the use of reeds and related materials.

children.name: Glass crafts
Glassblowing
children.definition: The craft of constructing glass vessels by means of blowing into molten glass.
All crafts which involve the use of glass as a source material.

children.name: Paper crafts
Bookbinding
children.definition: The craft of constructing decorative and ornate bindings for hand-printed books.

children.name: Origami
children.definition: The Japanese craft of folding paper into decorative shapes and figures.
The study of all crafts which involve the making or use of paper as a source material.

children.name: Crafts not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Crafts categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the use of a variety of materials individually and in combination to create pleasing and useful items. Includes a high proportion of practical work.

children.name: Imaginative writing
Scriptwriting
children.definition: The study of/training in the writing of scripts for theatre/television or motion picture productions.

children.name: Poetry writing
children.definition: The study of/training in the writing of poems.

children.name: Prose writing
children.definition: The study of/training in the writing of prose.

children.name: Imaginative writing not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Imaginative Writing categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of the creation of fictional text.

children.name: Others in creative arts & design
Creative arts & design not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the Others in Creative Arts and Design categories. To be used sparingly.
Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Creative Arts and Design categories. To be used sparingly.
N/A

children.name: Education
Training teachers
Training teachers - nursery
children.definition: The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to pre-school children.

children.name: Training teachers - primary
Training teachers - infant (key stage 1)
children.definition: The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to children in school years 1 to 2 inclusive.

children.name: Training teachers - junior (key stage 2)
children.definition: The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to children in school years 3 to 6 inclusive.
The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to children in school years 1 to 6 inclusive.

children.name: Training teachers - secondary
Training teachers - key stage 3
children.definition: The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to children in school years 7 to 9 inclusive.

children.name: Training teachers - key stage 4
children.definition: The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to children in school years 10 to 11 inclusive.
The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to children in school years 7 to 11 inclusive.

children.name: Training teachers - tertiary
Training teachers - further education
children.definition: The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to people in education years 12 to 13 inclusive.

children.name: Training teachers - higher education
children.definition: The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to people registered on a higher education course.
The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to people above school year 11.

children.name: Training teachers - adult education
Training teachers - coaching
children.definition: The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to sportsmen and women.

The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to adults. May include teaching of management training techniques, restructuring of teaching methods to take account of part-time study etc.

children.name: Training teachers - specialist
Training teachers - special needs
children.definition: The training of others to use non-standard methods to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to people with special needs.

children.name: Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL)
children.definition: The training of others to use non-standard methods to teach English to people whose first language is not English.
The training of others to use non-standard methods to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to people with particular learning requirements.

children.name: Training teachers not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Training Teachers categories. To be used sparingly.
The training of others to impart, explain and disseminate knowledge, skills and learning to a third party.

children.name: Research & study skills in education
Research skills
children.definition: The study of investigative method and the collection of information.

children.name: Study skills
children.definition: The study of individual learning ability and techniques with the aim of improving their efficacy and efficiency.

children.name: Research & study skills in education not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Research and Study Skills in education categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of investigative method and the collection of information with the aim of improving individual learning ability and efficiency.

children.name: Academic studies in education
Academic studies in nursery education
children.definition: The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in pre-school children.

children.name: Academic studies in primary education
children.definition: The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in children in school years 1 to 6 inclusive.

children.name: Academic studies in secondary education
children.definition: The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in children in school years 7 to 11 inclusive.

children.name: Academic studies in tertiary education
Academic studies in further education
children.definition: The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people in education years 12 to 13 inclusive.

children.name: Academic studies in higher education
children.definition: The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people in higher education.

The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people above school year 11.

children.name: Academic studies in adult education
children.definition: The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in adults.

children.name: Academic studies in specialist education
children.definition: The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people with particular learning requirements.

children.name: Academic studies in education (across phases)
children.definition: The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people of all ages.

children.name: Academic studies in education not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Academic studies in Education categories. To be used sparingly.
The study of teaching and learning, the arrangement of the curriculum, and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve group learning ability and efficiency.

children.name: Others in education
Education not elsewhere classified
children.definition: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the Others in Education categories. To be used sparingly.
Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Education categories. To be used sparingly.
N/A
